availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Throckmorten (Harrison County, Kentucky, clerk and pvt. 21st Ky Vol. Inf.)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Mathew O. Throckmorton and Elizabeth Throckmorton. Married to Carrie T. Allen Throckmorton in Taylor County, Kentucky, in February 1864. Father of G. William Throckmorton. Clerk in Harrison County in 1860. Served in the 21st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 12, 1861, to December 9, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 582.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Oldham County, La Grange, p. 67B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Illinois, La Salle County, Ottawa, p. 573D.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Taylor County Marriages, Film #000983728, p. 401.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0344.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky, Application #1059597, Certificate #760681.
Find A Grave, "William W Throckmorton (1838-1913)," Memorial #53464492, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/53464492 (accessed December 3, 2020).
